snippet: Many New Yorkers found it difficult to sit still as images of desolate city residents filled their television screens.
abstract: New Yorkers looking to help with relief efforts for Hurricane Sandy stream into the hardest-hit sections of New York City, overwhelming city relief centers; Mayor Michael R Bloomberg suggests that well-meaning volunteers and those dropping off goods donate money instead.
lead_paragraph: Many New Yorkers found it difficult to sit still as images of desolate city residents filled their television screens.

headline.seo: Volunteers and Donations Flock to Areas Affected by Hurricane Sandy
headline.main: Volunteers Flock to Disaster Areas, Overwhelming City Relief Centers
headline.print_headline: Volunteers Flock to Disaster Areas, Overwhelming City Relief Centers
